intro: Stylidium evolutum, commonly known as the curling triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally coiled leaves that curl tightly when disturbed. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Stylidium evolutum is a perennial herb that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
